features: EASY TO USE AND TOSS: Our wipes are made from ultrathin, plant-based fibers and compostable materials allowing them to dissolve in water. You can easily wipe, toss, and flush our wipes without harming the environment.

FOR SENSITIVE SKIN: Eco by Naty produces organic baby wipes that are free of synthetics and plastics, contain no GMOs, and are chemical-free. The plant-based fibers are soft to the touch and hypoallergenic, better for newborn sensitive skin.

NATURAL, PLANT BASED WIPES: Our baby diaper wipes are independently certified by Ecocert Cosmos for natural and organic cosmetics. With a pure water content and natural plant fibers, they’re certified for bio degradation in freshwater and in composting.
RENEWABLE PACKAGING: Each baby wipes pack is packaged with sustainable, renewable materials making the entire purchase compostable, safe, and eco-friendly.

GOOD FOR BABY, GOOD FOR NATURE: Eco by Naty was first started in Sweden nearly 27 years ago. Today, we continue with our goal to create products that are not only safe for our bodies, but that are also good for the environment. Our High-Tech Eco Products are backed by independent sustainability certifications, we offer the greenest products, all made from nature!
body.description: Eco Cert: Cosmos Organic. Cruelty free- Certified vegan free label. When we say we care about the planet, we mean the animals live here too. Thats why we never harm any living creatures when making products. Flushable wipes. Plastic here. Swim, yeah! Check out what's inside. All our ingredients are natural origin of total amount Cosmos Natural certified by Ecocert Greenlife according to Cosmos Standard. Our promise. 100% independently cerified Find out how we select our awesome ingredients at Naty.com Packaging made of renewable materials TUV Austria: Ok compost - Home. 100% water compostable- certified TUV Austria. Our wipes are completely biodegradable in water. Eco cert. Cosmos natural. 0% plastic. No nasty chemicals- certified by Ecocert Cosmos. Naty wipes contain 99.51% plant based ingredients. 100% renewable materials. Our products are plant based which means they are completely free. Born in Sweden. Made in Turkey

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: They didn’t tear easily and I trust the ingredients for my kiddo.I wish the seal was better in the bag so they didn’t dry out but we used them to quickly enough it wasn’t a big deal

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The BEST eco-friendly flushable wipes on the market
reviews.reviewText: A while back I got into switching my everyday products for more sustainable ones, and that's when I found Eco by Naty wipes. I initially had no clue they were baby wipes, but I loved that they were unscented, flushable, eco-friendly/biodegradable, and thick enough to do the job. I have repurchased these things 10243947 times and will continue to do so now that we are expecting our first baby. They are super gentle on the skin, flush with NO problem (have never had issues with plumbing or toilets clogging), and last us forever. They are genuinely the only thing that help me feel clean, and I love that I can have peace of mind, knowing they're far safer and more environmentally-friendly than some of the competing brands.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great But Some Things To Consider
reviews.reviewText: These wipes feel great and it’s awesome that they’re eco friendly but they’re not my cup of tea. Just a few small things, they have a scent that I personally don’t like (doesn’t mean you won’t like it!) and they are very thin - which makes it hard to separate them and pull them out of the packaging one at a time. I kept having to just pull a few out all stuck together and shove the extra back in ha. But if you like thin wipes, maybe they’re for you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Be gentle these are flushable for sure
reviews.reviewText: They are flimsy but if I am gentle it's not bad. They have a very light fresh scent, and I have had no rash or any skin issues. You might have to use several... just know you are paying to flush it and not clog- not for durability.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Poor packaging results in lots of waste
reviews.reviewText: The wipes themselves are great, my issue is with the packaging. The sticky clear piece covering the opening will not re-stick after a few times, resulting in the wipes drying out and getting discolored. We have never finished a package without at least the last 25% drying out, such a waste. The wipes are also difficult to remove, often resulting in many coming out, this is especially problematic when your 5 year old attempts to pull one, and ends up with 2 feet worth of wipes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Glad I didn’t read the reviews.
reviews.reviewText: Okay, so these are smaller than other wipes.However, they perform. They are thick and strong, as well as soft. They dispense easily from my OXO dispenser (more easily than most!!). They aren’t scented. I only have to use more than 1 wipe with really big poops…no more than other bigger wipes. They’re cheaper than most eco-friendly wipes.And most importantly, they don’t irritate my daughter’s sensitive skin.The only downside is the size, but that isn’t a big problem. Also, the package is small, so that’s a lot of extra plastic.If there were issues in the past, the manufacturer has certainly resolved them. My guess is someone was selling old wipes. Who knows. Certainly worth a shot if you want disposable wipes that degrade faster and are more eco-friendly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Been using for years
reviews.reviewText: Recommend that you put these in a plastic baby wipe container for easier use. Otherwise it's difficult to open and shut the packages all the time and they do dry out. But, if kept in a plastic container these are great and i love that they're flushable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2021
reviews.reviewText: HORRIBLE. These wipes suck. I was on the hunt for a natural/chemical free flushable wipe and these had some good reviews so I gave them a try. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. They stick together and it’s impossible to get just one out of the package. If you do somehow manage to get one, there is a 99.9% chance it’s going to rip. They are so thin and flimsy and you cannot wipe without them further ripping. I have an entire case of these wipes and I’m just going to throw them out and continue my search for a better wipe!

Brought these backpacking because I needed something that didn't attract bears or other wildlife. They have a slight citrus scent in my opinion and being allergic to perfumes they didn't bother me at all. I felt clean without feeling sticky, which I find most other wipes do.

reviews.reviewTitle: They do not break down in water
reviews.reviewText: They do not break down in water
Super Produkt, keine Irritationen, lässt sich gut Herausziehen aus der Verpackung, verstopft Toilette nicht.

En casa hemos utilizado pañales de tela con nuestros 3 hijos, pero durante el primer mes de vida o cuando salimos de vacaciones, utilizamos los pañales Naty ya que son ecológicos, no tienen plásticos y no irritan la piel. Las tallas se ajustan perfectamente a los diferentes pesos de los bebés.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good quality product but a bit expensive
